Lucien
 The 17 Generations of Goto (Japanese text). the hard and softback editions
are two different books, the hard cover is by Shimada and the soft cover is
the Sano Museum catalogue, both are out of print but I have the Sano at
GBP50 plus post if anybody needs one.
Alan

----- Original Message -----
From: "Ron Hartmann" <swords@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, September 22, 2003 8:09 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] goto kodogu study


: Lucien -
:
: I believe the NBTHK book by Fukushi Sensei is a very large volume that
came out a year or so ago. If so--and I have a copy myself but have yet to
really "get into it"--it is pricey and (I believe) out-of-print. The only
book on Goto I had prior to this large work was the one titled: The 17
Generations of Goto (Japanese text). I have this in both hard cover and soft
cover, I believe both being the same inside the covers. It seems very good
but as always, so much is missed unless you can read Japanese.
:
: Hopefully those who attended this year's San Francisco show saw the small
but significant display of Goto fittings put on by Rick Mantigani and Dan
Burns. Absolutely awesome kodogu! Unbelievable crisp and "minty" items of
high, high quality makers! This display has been shown the last few years
but I really wonder how many people stop to study the treasures displayed.
:
: Some of these Goto fittings--and others--have been included as special
inserts (high quality photos and printing) in the Northern California
group's newsletter from time to time.
:
: Ron
: STL
:
:   ----- Original Message -----
:   From: JapaneseSwords@...
:   To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
:   Sent: Sunday, September 21, 2003 4:12 PM
:   Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] goto kodogu study
:
:
:   Lucien,
:
:   The best Goto book out there is Goto Book from NBTHK By: Fukushi Sensei
:   Another good book is SWORD FITTINGS BY THE FAMILY OF GOTO  1440 - 1879
1994.
:   Sano Art Museum, Nezu Institute of Fine Arts, Tokugawa Art Museum.
:
:   I'm sure that there are other books on Goto fittings, but these two come
to
:   mind first.
:
:   Lou
